data_id: Why Your Next Manufacturing Hire Sh
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: Why Your Next Manufacturing Hire Should Be AI.In today's competitive manufacturing landscape, efficiency and precision are more critical than ever. AI is not just a buzzword; it's a transformative force that can turn your operations into a finely-tuned machine. Imagine hiring an AI that never tires, never errs, and continuously learns to enhance its performance.AI can streamline production by predicting equipment failures before they happen, thanks to predictive maintenance. This not only minimizes downtime but also extends the life of your machinery. AI can also optimize supply chains, predicting demand with impressive accuracy and reducing waste while ensuring timely delivery.Quality control is another area where AI shines. While human inspectors might overlook minute defects, AI systems use machine learning and computer vision to catch inconsistencies with unparalleled precision. This ensures your products meet the highest standards every time they leave the production line.Furthermore, AI-driven automation can handle repetitive tasks, freeing up your human workforce to focus on more complex and creative aspects of the job. This synergy between human insight and AI efficiency can lead to innovation and improved job satisfaction for your team.But the transition to AI doesn't have to be overwhelming. Start by identifying repetitive tasks and processes that could benefit from automation. Seek AI solutions that align with your specific needs and consider partnering with experts to guide the implementation.AI is not just another tool; it's a strategic partner in your business growth. By integrating AI, you position your manufacturing business for a future where efficiency, precision, and innovation are the norm, not the exception.P.S. data_id: How ChatGPT copies (steals?) any Yo
name: Ruben Hassid
description: Master AI before it masters you.
post_text: How ChatGPT copies (steals?) any YouTube image:1. Screenshot a thumbnail on YouTube.2. Upload it + your own photo in ChatGPT.3. Copy & paste the following prompt with it:"Create image. Recreate this thumbnail (first photo), but with my face on it (second photo)."WARNING: I'm sharing AI capabilities. Don't commit copyright infringement. Be a decent human being.So how to (actually) use ChatGPT for YouTube?1. Make a raw sketch of your thumbnail (on Canva?).2. Add as many written directions as possible to it.3. Upload it on ChatGPT, with the following prompt:"Turn this sketch into a hyper-realistic 1920x1080 youtube thumbnail. follow the rules that are given on the thumbnail in text."I added an example in the comment section.And this is absolutely wild.If your friend makes designs, get them on board.AI is coming at them fast. Real fast.…more

data_id: AI is Coming for White-Collar Jobs
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: AI is Coming for White-Collar Jobs - Here’s How to Stay AheadThe rapid evolution of AI is transforming industries at an unprecedented pace, and white-collar jobs are feeling the impact. But rather than fear these changes, let's explore how you can harness AI to enhance your career and business.First, understanding AI's capabilities is crucial. AI excels at processing vast amounts of data quickly, automating repetitive tasks, and providing insights through predictive analytics. These abilities can be leveraged to improve efficiency and decision-making in roles like finance, marketing, and HR. By integrating AI tools into your workflow, you can focus on strategic initiatives rather than mundane tasks.Next, consider upskilling. Familiarize yourself with AI terminology and concepts. Online courses, webinars, and workshops are excellent starting points to learn about AI applications relevant to your industry. Understanding the basics of machine learning, natural language processing, and data analysis can set you apart in a competitive job market.Collaboration with AI is another key strategy. AI tools should complement human skills, not replace them. Emphasize creativity, emotional intelligence, and complex problem-solving - areas where humans excel. By combining these strengths with AI capabilities, you can create innovative solutions that drive business growth.Networking with AI professionals can also provide valuable insights. Join AI-focused groups, attend industry conferences, and engage in discussions to stay informed about the latest trends and technologies. Sharing experiences and learning from others can spark new ideas and foster a community of innovation.Lastly, adaptability is essential. The AI landscape is dynamic, and staying flexible will help you navigate changes. Be open to experimenting with new tools and approaches, and don't hesitate to pivot when necessary.By embracing AI as a partner rather than a threat, you can position yourself and your business to thrive in the age of AI.P.S. data_id: AI-Enhanced Recruiting: Is It the E
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: AI-Enhanced Recruiting: Is It the End of Bias in Hiring?In the world of recruitment, finding the right candidate is often like searching for a needle in a haystack. Bias, whether conscious or unconscious, has long been a challenge, clouding judgment and affecting diversity in the workplace. Enter AI-enhanced recruiting, a technology that's transforming how businesses identify and hire talent.AI has the potential to minimize bias by focusing strictly on data. Algorithms can be designed to evaluate candidates based on skills, experience, and qualifications rather than subjective factors like appearance, background, or even the name on a resume. But does this mean AI can completely eliminate bias?While AI tools are powerful, they are only as good as the data they're trained on. If the data set used to train the AI model includes historical biases, those biases can be perpetuated. Therefore, ensuring diverse and inclusive data is crucial. Companies must invest in regularly updating and auditing their AI systems to avoid inadvertently reinforcing existing biases.Moreover, AI can streamline the initial stages of recruitment, efficiently sifting through thousands of applications to shortlist the best candidates. This allows human recruiters to focus on deeper, qualitative assessments. AI can also assist in crafting more inclusive job descriptions, analyzing language to ensure it attracts a diverse pool of applicants.Transparency is key. Businesses should communicate how AI is being used in their hiring processes to build trust among candidates and stakeholders. It's also important to remember that AI should enhance, not replace, human decision-making. The human touch remains vital in assessing cultural fit and potential growth.AI in recruitment is a step forward, but it's not a silver bullet. Businesses must remain vigilant and proactive in using AI responsibly to genuinely reduce bias and foster a more diverse and inclusive workforce.P.S. What measures does your company take to ensure AI recruiting tools are free from bias?Want to learn how to implement Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions for your business operations? Get in touch or follow AI-First here:https://lnkd.in/gxVWP3_n🔄 Repost this post…more

data_id: Are AI Models Making Human Employee
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: Are AI Models Making Human Employees Obsolete?The rise of Artificial Intelligence has sparked a heated discussion: could machines replace human workers? While AI is undeniably transforming industries, the idea that it will make human employees obsolete overlooks the potential for collaboration between humans and machines.AI excels at processing vast amounts of data quickly and accurately, identifying patterns, and performing repetitive tasks. This means that AI can handle routine work, freeing up humans to focus on tasks that require creativity, emotional intelligence, and strategic thinking. For instance, in customer service, AI can manage basic inquiries, allowing human agents to tackle complex issues and build relationships with customers.In marketing, AI can analyze consumer data to predict trends and optimize campaigns, but it’s the human touch that crafts compelling messages and understands cultural nuances. Similarly, in healthcare, AI can assist in diagnosing diseases, but the empathy and critical thinking of human doctors are irreplaceable.Businesses adopting AI see it as a tool to enhance human capabilities, not replace them. Companies are already using AI to automate mundane tasks, which increases efficiency and productivity. This approach allows employees to engage in more meaningful and innovative work, leading to job satisfaction and career growth.So, how can businesses ensure they remain human-centric in an AI-driven world? First, invest in training programs that equip employees with the skills to work alongside AI. Encourage a culture of continuous learning and adaptability. Second, involve employees in the AI implementation process, ensuring AI systems are designed to complement their work.Finally, communicate transparently about AI’s role in the organization, addressing any concerns about job displacement. Emphasize the collaborative potential of AI and humans working together.AI is not here to replace us but to empower us to do more. The key is understanding how to harness this technology to unlock new opportunities for both businesses and their employees.P.S. How do you think AI can enhance your role at work?Want to learn how to implement Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions for your business operations? name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: The Surprising Way AI Models Improve Workplace ProductivityIn today's fast-paced business environment, staying competitive means continually improving workplace productivity. One often overlooked method is the integration of AI models. These intelligent systems are not just tech advancements; they are game changers for the way we work.AI models can automate repetitive tasks, freeing up valuable time for employees to focus on more strategic and creative endeavors. Imagine a world where data entry, scheduling, and routine customer inquiries are handled seamlessly by AI. This shift allows your team to invest energy in innovation and problem-solving, which are crucial for growth.But the benefits don't stop there. AI models also enhance decision-making processes. By analyzing vast amounts of data quickly and accurately, AI provides insights that were previously difficult to obtain. This means faster, data-driven decisions, reducing the risk of human error and leading to better outcomes.Moreover, AI models can personalize the work experience. For instance, they can adapt learning and development programs to fit individual employee needs, ensuring that each person is growing in areas that will most benefit the company. This not only boosts productivity but also enhances employee satisfaction and retention.Integrating AI into the workplace is more accessible than it seems. Begin by identifying areas where AI can have the most impact and start small. Use pilot projects to test and refine AI applications before scaling them across the organization. Training your team to work alongside AI will also be crucial. Investing in upskilling ensures that employees are comfortable and capable of leveraging these tools effectively.AI models are transforming the way we work, making businesses more agile and responsive. Embrace this technology, and watch your workplace productivity soar.P.S. data_id: How AI Chatbots Are Improving Menta
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: How AI Chatbots Are Improving Mental Health SupportThe demand for mental health services has been on the rise, and traditional support systems are struggling to keep up. Enter AI chatbots, the unsung heroes quietly transforming how we access mental health support. By offering a unique blend of accessibility, anonymity, and immediate assistance, AI chatbots are revolutionizing mental healthcare.These digital companions provide users with a safe space to express themselves without fear of judgment. Available 24/7, they offer support whenever someone needs it the most - whether during a late-night anxiety episode or a mid-day stress breakdown. This round-the-clock availability reduces the barrier to entry for individuals who might hesitate to seek help due to stigma or logistical challenges.AI chatbots are also designed to recognize patterns in conversations, helping to identify triggers and suggest coping mechanisms. While they are not a replacement for professional therapists, they serve as a bridge, offering immediate support until a more comprehensive treatment plan is in place.Furthermore, chatbots can handle multiple interactions simultaneously, allowing them to support more people than human therapists can manage at one time. This scalability is crucial, especially in areas where mental health resources are scarce.Businesses are also taking note of the benefits AI chatbots bring to mental health. By integrating these tools into their wellness programs, companies can offer employees discreet access to mental health support, leading to improved well-being and productivity.However, it's essential to approach this tool with an understanding of its limitations. Human oversight remains critical, and AI chatbots should be part of a broader, more comprehensive mental health strategy. As AI continues to evolve, its role in mental health support will undoubtedly expand, offering even more innovative solutions to meet growing demands.P.S. data_id: AI in Coding Education: Can it Real
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: AI in Coding Education: Can it Really Teach You to Code?The idea of learning to code through AI might seem futuristic, but it's becoming a practical reality. As someone new to AI, you might wonder if AI can truly teach coding skills effectively. Let's explore how AI is transforming the learning experience and what this means for your business.Firstly, AI offers personalized learning paths. Traditional coding classes often follow a one-size-fits-all approach, which can be daunting for beginners. AI-driven platforms, however, adapt to your pace and style, offering tailored exercises that target your specific needs. This means you can focus on areas where you need improvement, making the learning process more efficient.Secondly, AI provides instant feedback. In a traditional setting, you might have to wait for an instructor to review your code. AI can analyze your work in real time, pointing out errors, suggesting improvements, and offering explanations. This immediate feedback loop accelerates learning, allowing you to quickly correct mistakes and solidify your understanding.Moreover, AI tools can simulate real-world coding challenges. These simulations allow you to apply what you've learned in a practical context, bridging the gap between theory and practice. By working through these scenarios, you gain the confidence to tackle real coding projects in your business.While AI is a powerful tool for learning to code, it doesn't replace human instructors. Instead, it complements them by handling repetitive tasks and providing data-driven insights into your progress. This frees up instructors to focus on more complex queries, offering deeper insights and strategic guidance.For business leaders, integrating AI into coding education can also be a game-changer. It equips your team with the skills needed to develop AI-driven solutions, fostering innovation and maintaining a competitive edge.P.S. data_id: AI-powered language learning: A sma
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: AI-powered language learning: A smarter way to speak?Have you ever thought about how AI could transform the way we learn languages? Traditional methods often require a significant time investment and can be frustratingly rigid. However, AI is revolutionizing this space by offering dynamic, personalized learning experiences.Imagine a language tutor that adapts to your pace and proficiency level. AI algorithms analyze how you interact with learning materials, identifying your strengths and pinpointing areas that need improvement. This means every lesson is tailored specifically to you, maximizing efficiency and effectiveness.One of the most fascinating aspects of AI in language learning is its ability to provide real-time feedback. Speech recognition technology can assess pronunciation instantaneously, offering corrections and tips to help you sound more like a native speaker. This immediate feedback loop accelerates learning and boosts confidence.But AI doesn't stop at just pronunciation. It can simulate immersive experiences by creating virtual environments where you can practice conversational skills. This kind of interactive learning can make the process more engaging and less intimidating than traditional classroom settings.Moreover, AI language apps often incorporate gamification elements to keep learners motivated. Reward systems, challenges, and interactive exercises can make learning feel like play, reducing burnout and maintaining interest over time.Adopting AI tools for language learning can be particularly beneficial for businesses. In our global economy, language skills are a crucial asset, enhancing communication and expanding market reach. AI solutions can fast-track the process, equipping teams with the necessary skills to thrive in diverse environments.So, is AI a smarter way to learn a new language? Many would say yes, given its ability to personalize, engage, and accelerate the learning process. For businesses, this could mean more efficient training programs and a workforce ready to meet global challenges head-on.P.S. data_id: AI in sales: Closing deals or closi
name: AI-First Business Solutions
post_text: AI in sales: Closing deals or closing doors?In today's fast-paced sales environment, AI is becoming an essential tool for businesses aiming to enhance their sales strategy. The promise of AI is tantalizing: automate repetitive tasks, identify promising leads, and provide insights that can transform how sales teams operate. But with this power comes a pivotal question - is AI helping us win more deals, or is it inadvertently creating barriers?AI excels in data analysis, processing vast amounts of information that would otherwise be overwhelming for human teams. By analyzing customer interactions, AI can predict buying behaviors and suggest the best actions to take. This can dramatically increase conversion rates and foster a more personalized sales approach.However, the implementation of AI in sales isn't without its challenges. One of the biggest hurdles is ensuring that AI systems are integrated smoothly with existing workflows. If not executed properly, AI tools might lead to confusion or inefficiency, potentially closing doors instead of deals. It's crucial that businesses invest time in training their teams to work alongside AI systems. This collaboration can harness AI's strengths while relying on human intuition and empathy to guide the sales process.Additionally, the ethical considerations of AI in sales cannot be ignored. Maintaining customer trust is paramount, and misuse of AI's capabilities, like over-personalization or intrusive data practices, can damage relationships. Transparency in how AI tools are used is essential to gaining and maintaining customer confidence.To truly benefit from AI, sales teams need to view it as an augmentative tool rather than a replacement for human skills. When AI and human expertise are combined, the result is a powerful sales strategy that not only closes deals but also builds lasting customer relationships.P.S. How do you envision AI transforming your sales process?Want to learn how to implement Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions for your business operations? post_text: The fusion of projectors and artificial intelligence (AI) is a groundbreaking leap in how we preserve and interact with history while shaping the future of education and innovation. This synergy combines the visual brilliance of advanced projection systems with the cognitive capabilities of AI to deliver immersive, interactive experiences that were once the realm of science fiction. Imagine standing in your living room as a 15th-century surgical procedure unfolds before your eyes, meticulously reconstructed using historical data and projected onto your hand in stunning, lifelike detail. With AI's ability to analyze, recreate, and enhance data, this technology not only transports us back in time but also revolutionizes how we learn and train. Historical education becomes an adventure, where ancient architectural marvels, cultural practices, or scientific breakthroughs are brought to life as though you were physically there. For students and professionals, interactive learning takes on new dimensions, enabling the exploration of complex topics like human anatomy or engineering designs through detailed, AI-driven projections. In professional training, surgeons, engineers, and educators can simulate high-stakes scenarios with unparalleled precision, honing their skills in safe yet realistic environments. This blend of projectors and AI is more than a tool—it's a bridge between the past and future, transforming traditional learning into an engaging, dynamic journey that captivates and educates. As this technology evolves, the possibilities are boundless, promising a future where the lessons of history and the innovations of tomorrow are seamlessly integrated into our everyday lives. What moment in history or future innovation would you like to explore with this remarkable technology? post_text: We’ve all been frustrated with inefficient robo vacuums. Roborock Saros Z70: A Robotic Vacuum with a Robotic Arm is promising to change all of thay. The Roborock Saros Z70, with its OmniGrip™ robotic arm, represents a significant leap in home automation by combining cleaning and object-handling capabilities. It can pick up items like socks and toys, clearing cleaning paths and even relocating objects to designated areas. This innovation could transform homes by reducing manual tidying, enhancing cleaning efficiency, and integrating with smart home systems for personalized assistance. Features like object recognition, mapping, and AI-driven navigation make it a versatile tool for managing cluttered spaces while maintaining cleanlinessThe StarSight 2.0 mapping technology enhances cleaning efficiency by using advanced 3D Time-of-Flight (ToF) sensors and dual-light LiDAR to map spaces with over 21,600 data points per session. This enables precise navigation, obstacle recognition, and spatial awareness, allowing the vacuum to clean closer to edges and corners without collisions or missed spots. It can differentiate between 73 types of obstacles, adjust cleaning strategies dynamically, and operate effectively in complex layouts or low-light conditions, ensuring thorough and uninterrupted cleaningHow could robotics like this change our homes and improve our lives?—————————About me: Creator of ethical & loving AI models and apps for hire. post_text: Technology has evolved at an unprecedented pace, reshaping industries, economies, and daily life in ways once thought impossible. From the early mechanical inventions of the Industrial Revolution to the rapid advancements in artificial intelligence, biotechnology, and quantum computing, technological evolution has been both exponential and transformative. The digital age, driven by the internet, cloud computing, and big data, has enabled seamless global connectivity, fostering innovation across various fields. Artificial intelligence and machine learning are now revolutionizing industries such as healthcare, finance, and education, automating complex processes and enhancing decision-making. The integration of the Internet of Things (IoT) has created smart ecosystems, where devices communicate and optimize operations in real-time, improving efficiency and convenience. Biotechnology and nanotechnology are pushing the boundaries of medical science, leading to personalized medicine and groundbreaking treatments. Meanwhile, quantum computing is poised to redefine problem-solving, offering solutions to challenges that were previously unsolvable by classical computers. However, with rapid technological progress come ethical dilemmas, concerns over data privacy, and the need for regulations to ensure responsible innovation. As technology continues to evolve, the focus must be on balancing progress with ethical considerations, ensuring that advancements serve humanity while addressing challenges such as digital security, misinformation, and economic disparities. The future of hashtag#technology lies in interdisciplinary collaboration, where AI, robotics, and human ingenuity converge to create a more intelligent, sustainable, and interconnected world.—————————About me: Creator of ethical & loving AI models and apps for hire. Editor-in-Chief of the HonestAI Magazine and 3x founder focused on building trustworthy/trustless tech products that serve humankind. Open to developing AI projects (link in bio).About HonestAI Magazine: Join the exclusive AI magazine club (95K readers) at https://lnkd.in/g8f8rwU4. It offers such beautiful and ethical insights into the fascinating world of AI. Here’s the March’25 edition of the magazine to download as clickable links PDF: https://lnkd.in/dnD3NZBzP.S. We’re looking for experts who are passionate about writing on AI and we’ll feature them on our magazine. We’re also looking for experts who are AI creators and we’ll feature them on our upcoming podcast series.VC - Reserved to respective owners!.

post_text: Ghibli Meets Interstellar With ChatGPT's New ModelWitness the fusion of Studio Ghibli's enchanting style with the cosmic grandeur of "Interstellar," all brought to life by the power of Generative AI!Let's use this opportunity to dive into some core techniques and applications that make this level of art possible:1️⃣Automated Inbetweening: AI tools can generate intermediate frames between key poses, ensuring smooth transitions and reducing manual labor. This process, known as inbetweening, is crucial for achieving fluid animations.2️⃣Deep Learning for Realism: Deep learning algorithms analyze vast datasets to generate realistic character movements and environments. Techniques like Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) can create lifelike textures and backgrounds.3️⃣Procedural Animation: AI can simulate realistic physics and crowd behavior, allowing for dynamic and immersive animations. This method automates the creation of complex scenes based on predefined rules. How do you think the integration of AI in animation will impact the future of storytelling?Video credits: Kunal Bagaria (via X)🌟𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗔𝗜🌟𝘼 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙚𝙙𝙞𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣. 𝘼 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚. ♥️This April, Honest AI is diving deep into something that’s changing the game—quietly, powerfully, and collaboratively.You’ll hear voices from unexpected places, uncover stories behind systems you thought you understood, and explore a side of AI that feels… well, a little more human.It’s a journey that blurs the lines between innovation and intention. And trust us—what’s inside might just reshape the way you think about intelligence, creativity, and the crowd behind it all.👀 Curious? You should be. Stay tuned. April’s issue drops soon. 🤩🌟Follow The HonestAI Magazine for AI news. 💙🌟We are covering such ground breaking stories on AI. post_text: Side-by-Side Comparison: Original vs. Ghibli-Styled Lord of the Rings TrailerImagine a world where Studio Ghibli's enchanting style merges with the epic fantasy of J.R.R. Tolkien's "Lord of the Rings." A recent creative experiment brought this vision to life, blending AI tools with artistic vision.How the creator made it happen:🔹Screenshot and Remix: All 102 shots from the "Fellowship of the Ring" trailer were captured and remixed in the style of Studio Ghibli using OpenAI's Sora.🔹AI Animation: Scenes were animated using Kling.ai and LumaLabsAI, with prompts like "a man yells, fearful" to convey emotions without lip syncing.🔹Re-editing: The final edit was synchronized with the original trailer to maintain the narrative flow.What other iconic stories would you love to see reimagined through the lens of AI and different artistic styles?Video credits: PJaccetturo (via X)via @ civilengineeriing🌟𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗔𝗜🌟𝘼 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙚𝙙𝙞𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣. post_text: In today’s rapidly evolving business landscape, agility isn’t just about moving fast, it’s about adapting strategically to stay competitive. Organizations that lack change maturity often struggle with outdated processes, slow decision-making, and resistance to innovation.🚨 Where Businesses Struggle:❌ Slow response to market shifts❌ Resistance to new technologies and processes❌ Lack of alignment between strategy and execution🔹 How to Build Organizational Agility:✅ Establish a Change-Ready Culture – Shift mindsets from resistance to adaptability.✅ Strengthen Decision-Making Frameworks – Empower teams to act quickly and effectively.✅ Optimize Processes for Flexibility – Reduce bottlenecks that slow down execution.✅ Use Technology as a Growth Enabler – Leverage AI & automation for smarter business operations.Agility isn’t just about survival; it’s about long-term success. If your organization is struggling to navigate change, let’s discuss how to build a more agile, resilient business. Drop a comment or DM me to explore solutions.

post_text: We will all have different visceral reactions to hearing Bill Gates call jobs an “artifact of the shortage”; and when he says “it’s very hard to imagine this future”, that’s likely an understatement that will likely also mean different things to all of us.The man who technically owns this wonderful platform of LinkedIn plus Microsoft, but also in his ~$200B networth holds significant positions in both FedEx and UPS, both John Deere and Caterpillar Inc., as well as Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts., Walmart, Coca-Cola FEMSA, Ecolab, PACCAR (yes, EVs), AutoNation, Berkshire Hathaway as well as investments into real estate, agriculture, my new space (the “space space”) through Breakthrough Energy Ventures) (also: Reynolds American Inc. “big tobacco” and Procter & Gamble) BUT:nothing in the Universal Basic Income (UBI) space yet.I’d like to personally call on “Uncle Bill” to commit to deploy 7% of all bottom-line revenue across his portfolio OF INCREASED PROFITS DUE TO DISPLACEMENT OF HUMAN LABOR CAPITAL - aka “humans’ jobs”.To clarify, this 7% (a form of “Universal Basic Compute”) would ONLY be on revenue that came from work that used to be done by humans being paid to do it, but now displaced by A.I. automation, agents, robots, etc.Mr. Gates has been spending a lot of time and attention in and on India 🇮🇳 lately, which I personally love — but India, dispite being both the most populace country and also the world’s fastest growing economy, is a PRIME EXAMPLE of somewhere where UBI is most needed (much like here in Brazil 🇧🇷).Contemporaries of his like Sam Altman and even the divisive Elon Musk have worked on and discussed UBI (I believe that at least Sam actually means it too, and his World f/ Worldcoin project has made strides), vocally urged humanity and corporates to embrace UBI, and even Bill Gates recognizes in recent Netflix documentary “What’s Next” that UBI projects will be needed, could work and could “actually save money in the long run”.That concept and ‘mantra’ is one he and his mentor Warren Buffet take very, very seriously — and in fact, there are some brilliant business models around UBI.Also, in over 100 pilots of UBI in Finland 🇫🇮, Brazil, India, USA 🇺🇸 and many more, Mental Health issues almost always get reduced by over 90% and populations as well as individuals typically get more productive.The time to discuss and get all this right is NOW. Thanks, “Unc.”, for opening up like this at The Indian Express Adda. Let’s keep the dialogue open and flowing!Comment and share and tag Bill Gates to encourage him to accept this opportunity to be on the right side of history. 7% bottom line of displaced payroll from his holdings would translate to thousands of dollars for households and individuals monthly as we eek closer to a post-labor economy; then we can encourage Google, IBM, Siemens, Tata Group, Apple, Meta and all others to follow suit.hashtag#ubi hashtag#techforgood
data_id: We will all have different visceral
name: Cory Warfield
description: How do I have over 500K followers here (& 100+ recs)?? I speak ‘truth to tech’, share ‘good vibes’, highlight amazing people & companies & have friends in high places. Editor-in-Chief @ Tech For Good. Serial founder/BODs
